page.title: 19THE GREAT BED OF WARE
page.content: The Great Bed of Ware was said to have taken 30 years to make by Jonas Fosbrooke for {Edward IV}for royal use on state occasions and was completed in 1463. The bed is 2 metres high,3metres wide and 3 metres long.The bed was first installed at Ware Manor but when { {Thomas Fanshawe}moved he discarded the bed and it was purchased by a local inn. In 1610 Prince Ludwig Friedrich of Wurttemberg stayed in Ware at the White Hart Inn and slept in the bed. In its time the bed has also been in the George,the Crown,the Saracen's Head and Rye House Hotel.It is now at the {Victoria and Albert Museum.}
